data.description:
Don your deerstalker and step into the shoes of the world’s most famous sleuth in this gripping 1-4 player mystery detective adventure.  

With three cabinet members already murdered by hanging and Sherlock Holmes missing in action, it is up to you to find the killer before Big Ben strikes midnight. Interrogate suspects, analyse crime scenes, collect evidence, and enter your ‘Mind Palace’ to construct a compelling case in this ‘Whodunit’ that will push your deduction skills to their limits. Enjoy this narrative alone or with friends to make this a social sleuthing experience you will never forget. 

Combining the worlds of immersive theatre and VR, Sherlock Holmes: The Case of the Hung Parliament’ is a unique ‘evening-sized’ experience that you can enjoy again and again.

Please note: We are a small team and want to create the best possible experience, so any feedback you can share is appreciated. It will help us create an immersive and fun ‘Sherlock’ experience.

changelog.change_log:
Fixed a bug where Watson videos go out of sync if pausing the app/taking off the headset

Touching clues highlight functionality has been improved, now also vibrates the controller

Final Tutorial step is not finished by picking up paper, but by actually opening/closing settings

Tutorial order of steps has been rearranged to provide a more intuitive progression

Tutorial is now skippable

Multiplayer sessions are now saved and can be resumed when starting a new multiplayer game from the lobby

Settings are now saved between sessions, except for Muting and Player Height Increase option

Thumbstick movement now has a slider for speed in settings

Minor UI improvements and bugfixes

Minor Audio quality improvements

- Fixed a bug where sometimes (especially when first running the game) a 360 video wouldn’t load correctly and would cause players to get stuck in a video scene.
- Added descriptions for the Buttons in the Settings Menu.
- Added a Setting for 360 videos to view them either in Stereoscopic (different image for each eye, better depth perception at the cost of sharpness in parts of the video) or Monoscopic (single image for both eyes, better sharpness at the cost of depth perception, also more comfortable).
- You no longer have the 'Continue' button after finishing the game. (clicking it would’ve only brought you to the End Credits scene).
- Fixed a bug where a player doesn’t receive one of the doctor’s answers which she sends to you.
- Fixed a bug where clues were sometimes turning blue when placed on the evidence board in multiplayer.
- Small visual improvements and bugfixes.

- fixed an issue in multiplayer where clues sometimes followed another player inbetween rooms 
 - fixed issues where continuing previously saved game progress didn't update timer correctly 
 - fixed an issue where sometimes saved game progress didn't load when clickcing Continue 
 - minor bugfixes and improvements for messages
